storyName: I Come, I Conquer, I Define
storyInfo: Thorns cuts through the steam and defeats Anastasio. With the crisis over, the crew decides their respective futures. Juana dances one last time under the sunset.

attributes.content: I found them! Over here! They're here!
attributes.name: Warrior Priest

attributes.content: Raise your shields! Form up! Don't let her get away!
attributes.name: Warrior Priest

attributes.content: ...Tch.
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: All this, just for little ol' me? Besides, why do you think I'm trying to get away?
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: This is not the first time the Inquisition has tried to take Pascuala's life. But this is the last time she's running.
â€”Bring it on!
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: You wanna kill me? Go ahead and try!
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: But she is no warrior. It is all she can do to dodge the attacks of two warrior priests.
Soon, even that is becoming difficult.
Shield-wielding clerics block the way in front of her. Behind her is Teach, too weak to even stand.
*Cough*... What a shame...
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: What I wouldn't give to hear those guys squabbling again...
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: Guess that's too much to ask...
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: Hold on, hold on...
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Have you seen Thorns? He was fighting Anastasio just a moment ago!
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: ...It's just Anastasio over there now.
attributes.name: Weedy

attributes.content: Stop, Elysium! You can't steer and use high-powered Arts at the same time!
attributes.name: Weedy

attributes.content: Elysium!
attributes.name: Weedy

attributes.content: I have to find him.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Sure, he's lived through way more lab explosions than he had any right to, but he's still flesh and blood. Even saltfins have to avoid those steam jets. If...
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: We have to find him!
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: At long last, you have ended his suffering and brought salvation to the souls of those he tried to drag into the abyss along with him.
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: Timidly, hesitantly, Anastasio presses the tip of the sword against his own throat.
...No. You are not yet worthy to die. Freeing one poor soul who failed to recognize his desires to the last is not enough to atone for your sins.
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: Reality lies before you, Anastasio. You have yet to eradicate the blight of desire plaguing this land. You are not worthy to...
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: SeÃ±or Alguacil! Are you alright?
attributes.name: Warrior Priest

attributes.content: ...I am fine.
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: Regroup, slay the remaining bandits, and capture both ships.
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: I will take Juana myself.
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: SeÃ±or, you promised to pay the bandits...
attributes.name: Warrior Priest

attributes.content: They sought a reward from me like ravenous tuskbeasts, the saliva dribbling down their chins.
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: Did you truly think they could live honest lives in AarÃ³n, after being paid for such work?
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: False kindness is but the worst cruelty.
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: ...As you say, SeÃ±or Alguacil.
attributes.name: Warrior Priest

attributes.content: Anastasio can hear the soul-wrenching cries and wailing.
He knows he should board the ship, kill Juana, and end the struggle.
But he does not move.
He feels an emptiness, but does not know what is missing. It is as if Isidro had taken part of him with him.
He turns around to look at the vent Isidro had fallen into, but only the gushing steam answers him.
White steam bursts into red mist. Anastasio turns around to leave.
In the next instant, a flash of light cuts the steam open.
Isidro emerges from it. The Corazonix that had covered his entire body parts ways to reveal his golden eyes.
Anastasio sees something familiar in them. They are the eyes of one who thirsts to kill another, just like his own.
Many people have told me many things about Iberia and the ocean my entire life.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Some say the sea is Iberia's treasure, some its bane. Others say it is the final destination of the Iberians, their grave...
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Some have told me it was people like me who destroyed Iberia. Others that its revival depends on people like me.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Some have advised me to stay away from the ocean and live a normal life. Others tell me I can never truly escape it, for it is my only home.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: You've talked a lot about my desires.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: I admit it. I want to go out to sea.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: I want to see it for myself and conquer it.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Then, I will define what Iberia means to me.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: As he says these words, Isidro's sword finds Anastasio's neck.
Anastasio feels both relief and fear at the blood flowing from it.
His deepest sins flow out of him along with his blood. He is pure again.
Yet he frantically tries to stop the bleeding.
He is pure again. Meaning he can live again. As long as he stops the bleeding...
But only the blood will atone him.
Anastasio realizes his own paradox.
He stops his motion and falls from the ship and into the gap between the bones.
I want to go out to sea. I WILL go out to sea.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: No one can stop me.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Put down your weapons and let go of the wheel!
attributes.name: Warrior Priest

attributes.content: *Cough* Delay them, Leaf! Do whatever you have to! Buy as much time as you can!
attributes.name: Weedy

attributes.content: Can you hang in there, Elysium?
attributes.name: Weedy

attributes.content: *Cough* Yeah... for a little while...
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Attack!
attributes.name: Warrior Priest

attributes.content: You...
attributes.name: Weedy

attributes.content: You broke the ship again...
attributes.name: Weedy

attributes.content: I JUST FIXED IT!!!
attributes.name: Weedy

attributes.content: GET OUT!!!
attributes.name: Weedy

attributes.content: Wow, Weedy...
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Thorns!
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: You're okay!
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Dios mÃ­o, I can't believe I can see you again!
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: D-Don't ever do that again! Did you break your arms? Hmm? Legs? Strange. Everything seems fine. Is your head screwed on straight? Well, I guess it was never really screwed on straight to begin with...
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: ...How on Terra are Weedy and I supposed to write our post-action reports?!
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Whatever, just take this bottle of seasickness medicine.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: More stuff? How much have you given me on this trip? Besides, isn't it a little late for this?
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Oh, this one's different. It's extra-strong. It'll come in handy.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Throw the old one overboard.
attributes.name: Warrior Priest

attributes.content: If the little one fidgets, tie her up.
attributes.name: Warrior Priest

attributes.content: We need to learn how she stole the compass right from under our noses, and whether she had someone on the inside working with her.
attributes.name: Warrior Priest

attributes.content: Don't move! I'll bandage your wounds now.
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: Not one step forward!
attributes.name: Rus

attributes.content: You bastards! Your leader promised a reward! Why are you attacking us?
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: It is also the Alguacil who has sentenced you to death.
attributes.name: Warrior Priest

attributes.content: Vete a la mierda! Everything you people say is finshit!
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: Your leader is dead! Everyone saw him fall from the ship!
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: We can still carry out his will.
attributes.name: Warrior Priest

attributes.content: How?! Surrender, and we all go back to town in one piece! Don't, and we all die here!
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: We just want to live normal lives! Would you rather die than trust us?
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: Fine then, just try us!
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: The surviving pirates raise their swords with their leader's cry.
Not one warrior priest dares step forward.
Out of the way, jÃ³venes. I'll have the helm.
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: I said I would take you all out of this reef.
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: No, I'll do it.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: You're hurt. Besides, I have the compass.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: ...You do?
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: My arm is the compass. I'll explain later. Basically, I can predict when and where each and every jet of steam is going to gush out.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: We'll make it.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Excelente. Then we sail.
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: Where are you going, SeÃ±ora Juana?
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: I can't very well let Javier and the others die here.
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: They've already raised their sails. Looks like they're leaving.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: Everybody who can move, to your stations!
attributes.name: Rus

attributes.content: Is the Inquisition just going to watch?
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: Move your asses and help!
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: Follow La Conquista if you want to live!
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: We'll all make it out of Skeletal Reef in one piece!
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: Those on the salt ship breathe a sigh of relief when the last jet of steam can no longer reach them.
Some sit on the deck, some lie down, all exhausted.
Finally able to relax, Juana starts stomping around the deck.
Finding a spot that sounds hollow, she picks up a cutlass and pries open the planks, revealing a crate of rum.
Aha! Naturally, no one else would ever find MY rum.
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: We're not far from the sea, Javi!
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: It will be hard for the salt ship to turn back if it goes any further. Get some rest here. Isidro and I will draw a map of the reef's steam vents so you can sail your way back.
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: One moment.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: What is it?
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: I don't wanna force anyone into a life they don't want... If anyone wants to go with you, I won't stop them.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: Whoever wants to go out to sea with SeÃ±ora Juanaâ€”this is your last chance!
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: If you do, get aboard La Conquista!
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: The rest are coming back to town with me!
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: Going out to sea? You're still thinking about that? With no supplies, and a skeleton crew?
attributes.name: Rus

attributes.content: What about food and water? Materials for repairs? Medicine? Weapons? This is loco!
attributes.name: Rus

attributes.content: Why even bother at this point? She's out of her mind... sailing to their deaths...
attributes.name: Doubting Sailor

attributes.content: Are they really going out to sea? Now?
attributes.name: Impulsive Sailor

attributes.content: Er, Javier? I...
attributes.name: Impulsive Sailor

attributes.content: Like I said, it's your choice. I won't say anything.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: I don't want to live a life I don't want. So I won't force you to either.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: Choose. The sun's about to set.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: The crowd grows quiet and parts into two groups. A few follow Juana towards the edge of the deck, but turn around quickly.
Hey, hermano!
attributes.name: Reluctant Sailor

attributes.content: Listen, I've got a little package in my drawer. There's a pocketwatch inside, some money, and a letter. Can you take the letter to Abi in town?
attributes.name: Reluctant Sailor

attributes.content: If you do, the money's all yours. Just make sure she gets the letter, okay? Tell her to wait, because I'll be back with a big pile of coin.
attributes.name: Reluctant Sailor

attributes.content: You said... Ami?
attributes.name: Dizzy Sailor

attributes.content: Abi! The redhead!
attributes.name: Reluctant Sailor

attributes.content: Red Ami... gotcha..
attributes.name: Dizzy Sailor

attributes.content: You're not coming? Don't you wanna see the sea?
attributes.name: Resolute Sailor

attributes.content: I... I'm just too tired... My back's bad these days too. Can't even sleep in a hammock...
attributes.name: Weary Sailor

attributes.content: The bed we had back in town... it felt so good...
attributes.name: Weary Sailor

attributes.content: Guess this is it then.
attributes.name: Resolute Sailor

attributes.content: Adios!
attributes.name: Weary Sailor

attributes.content: Juana leaps upon La Conquista, followed by the sailors who elected to go with her.
Javier takes another swig of rum.
...Adios.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: The two ships ride with the wind, sailing across the Salt Flat at a leisurely pace.
Take care of Teach.
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: She's not so young anymore, and might need to lie down for a few days, but she should be fine.
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: You're not going with SeÃ±ora Juana?
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Nah, why the heck would I do that?
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: I'd rather have a good life, with a lot of money. Going out to sea sounds pretty rough if you ask me.
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: But you had their back this whole time. I was sure...
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Because Juana promised me a lot of money. A LOT of money!
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: Which will help me meet new people, and find ways to make even more money!
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: ...Wait!
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Save your breath. I'm just a dirty little thief, after all.
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: You won't change my mind with a few words.
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: Okay. Good luck. I hope you find what you want and live a good life.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Thanks, Pelirrojito.
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: Pascuala pats the salt off herself and jumps on the rope net linking the two ships.
Hasta la vista, baby!
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: Maybe I'll be rich the next time we meet!
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: Elysium!
attributes.name: Weedy

attributes.content: Elysium?
attributes.name: Weedy
Elysium
attributes.content: Hmm?

attributes.name: Elysium
attributes.content: Oh! What is it?
I was talking to SeÃ±ora Juana and Thorns. They want to go out to sea, but the ship has taken a beating.
attributes.name: Weedy

attributes.content: So I'm going to stay here a while and help with repairs. Getting to work with the frame of a genuine Golden Age battleship, plus a bionic transmission system designed by SeÃ±ora Juana herself based on saltfin biology... It's fascinating.
attributes.name: Weedy

attributes.content: Besides, I want to see if my research will be of use on this ship.
attributes.name: Weedy

attributes.content: How about you report back to Rhodes Island first? I'll be back once I'm done here.
attributes.name: Weedy

attributes.content: Will you be okay by yourself?
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Well, we're short on food, water, and comfortable bedding. Plus the only way to bathe is to wipe yourself off with salt... But nothing a dedicated researcher can't handle.
attributes.name: Weedy

attributes.content: A small price to pay for the chance to study such a fascinating subject. Besides, I have Leaf with me.
attributes.name: Weedy

attributes.content: Alright, I hope you find what you're looking for here.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: I'll get on with my blueprints, then. See you at Rhodes Island!
attributes.name: Weedy

attributes.content: You too!
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: My goodness... Look at what they did to my ship...
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: Don't say that! Weedy worked so hard to patch it up! You'll make me cry...
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: ...You really don't know when to stop talking, do you?
attributes.name: Juana
Elysium
attributes.content: A truly handsome man has a way with words!

attributes.name: Elysium
attributes.content: Are you preparing to set sail, SeÃ±ora Juana?
What's this now? Concerned for me?
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: We've had brushes with death together, ate dried saltfin together, even slept under the same blanket. The least I could do is bid you farewell before you go.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Buen camino, seÃ±ora.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: If we meet again, I'd love to hear all the stories of your adventures on the high seas.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Not a problem.
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: Walking around the deck, Elysium sees that Teach is finally beginning to regain consciousness.
Are you awake, SeÃ±ora Teach?
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: I'm going back to town with Javier's group. I came to say goodbye.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Haha... thanks...
attributes.name: Teach

attributes.content: You know, I've come to admire you a lot, seÃ±ora... You remind me of my own captain.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: May safe winds take you out to sea, that you may find the battles against wind and wave that you seek.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Thanks, chaval...
attributes.name: Teach

attributes.content: Oh, one more thing. Peludita asked me to give you these herbs. Works best when boiled, she said, but can also be chewed and swallowed directly if water is in short supply.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Gracias...
attributes.name: Teach

attributes.content: Elysium continues to stride the deck, until he has no more goodbyes left to say.
He walks up to the rope net linking the two ships, and sees a figure standing at the bow of La Conquista.
His old buddy.
He waves at Isidro from a distance.
Adios, amigo.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: The salt ship sails off slowly. On the deck, all is quiet, as the crew watches the people they know gradually became smaller.
A few rush up to the edge, as though they had changed their minds and wanted to jump across to the other ship, but are forced to stop as the distance between them grows.
They each watch the other go further and further away.
Look, Javier! The mast of La Conquista!
attributes.name: Rus

attributes.content: Ha... hahaha...
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: Atop the mast, Juana lifts the hems of her dress, as if stepping atop the setting sun.
The fading light adorns her dress with a golden glow.
Wind lifts white grains of salt from the ground like blowing snow.
All eyes are fixated upon her dance, both on this ship and the other.
They look up in silence. The ships sail in opposite directions, with only a few eyes glancing at the sea of white salt before them, and the sunset growing closer or further.
Away they go, until the figures on the other ship have become as small as grains of salt.
